reviewDescription: I'm really impressed with the Boult Crown R Pro Smart Watch. The 1.43 inch HD AMOLED display is stunning, with vibrant colors and crystal clear clarity. The zinc alloy frame and sleek design make it a stylish accessory. The watch offers seamless Bluetooth calling, and the working crown is a thoughtful touch. With 600 nits brightness, the display is easily readable even in harsh sunlight. The AI voice assistant is responsive, and the SpO2 monitoring feature provides valuable health insights. The 120+ sports modes cater to various fitness enthusiasts. Battery life is impressive, lasting up to 5 days on a single charge.Overall, the Boult Crown R Pro is an excellent smartwatch that offers a perfect blend of style, functionality, and affordability.Highly recommended for anyone seeking a reliable and feature packed smartwatch.

I’m thoroughly impressed with the Boult Crown R Pro! The 1.43’’ HD AMOLED display is stunning, and the 600 nits brightness makes it easy to see even in sunlight. Bluetooth calling works seamlessly, and the working crown adds a premium touch. The zinc alloy frame feels solid, and the AI voice assistant is surprisingly handy. Love the SpO2 monitoring and the variety of 120+ sports modes. It’s a complete package at this price—highly recommended!

reviewTitle: watch is excellent for price BUT No free Straps, Page misleads

reviewTitle: Good initial impression but display flicker within 2 days of use
reviewDescription: Ordered this on the 30th Dec 2024. Initial impression was good - nice and crisp display with a good collection of watch faces. The step count over reads by about 20-30% but I guess that is okay at this price point.However, the display started flickering yesterday (2nd Jan) within 2 days of use. So that now casts a cloud of doubt on the durability of the product. Tried contacting Boult  support but never got a response so I’ve raised the replacement request with Amazon. Let’s see.Other than that, in the last couple of days I was able to receive calls through the watch and don’t have any complaints. But I don’t like the fact that there is no log of historical data about heart rate, spo2 so you cannot see your heart rate over the last 24 hours but only instant readings. It would have been nice to see a graph similar to Xiomi fitness band but alas the iOS app only has graphical data for sleep tracking.All said, I would suggest this watch only for it’s looks and sharp display but if you’re looking for doing any moderately serious health tracking, I would suggest to look elsewhere.
